intro: Nitrophila occidentalis, commonly known as the western nitrophila, is a small, herbaceous plant native to North America. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils, often found in prairies and open woodlands. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale pink flowers. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley. Nitrophila occidentalis is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-rich environments, making it a common indicator species for certain soil conditions.
